intro: Cacalia mentrasto, commonly known as the purplehead bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet, often with a distinctive purple hue at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a charming touch to gardens with its elegant appearance.
